ground_truth: He stands shaking, staring wildly. Constanze gets up, perplexed. Overjoyed, she stops and kisses his hand. He raises her and then clasps her to him clumsily. They stare at one another: Constanze in total disbelief. He glares at her. Salieri sits at his desk, staring up at the cross. Salieri stares at the cross. Salieri stirs himself. A servant appears. She looks at him inquiringly, and drops the portfolio on the floor; pages of music pour out of it. To its grand and weighty sound, Constanze starts to undress, watched by the horrified Salieri. He opens his mouth in distress. The candle flickers over her as she removes her clothes and prepares for his embrace. CU, the fireplace. In it lies the olivewood Christ on the cross, burning. Mozart chuckles delightedly. Salieri offers him a glass of white dessert and a spoon. Mozart takes it absently and goes on talking. Hysterical barking and howling. The hall is full of dogs, at least five, all jumping up and dashing about and making a terrific racket. Mozart, dandified in a new coat and a plumed hat for the occasion, has arrived to teach at the house of a prosperous merchant, Michael Schlumberg. Bluff, friendly and coarse-looking, he stands in his hall amidst the leaping and barking animals, greeting Mozart. Suddenly the girl rises. Mozart smiles at the parents. They smile nervously back. Mozart slides along the bench, raises his hands, and preludes over the keys. Instantly, a dog howls loudly. Startled, Mozart stops. Mozart stops. Amazed, Mozart starts to play the Rondo again. The dog howls louder. He bows to them and leaves the room. Both men embrace. A cramped, low-ceilinged little room which nobody has tidied for ages. Also, there are many empty wine bottles; musical instruments - among them a mandolin, a viola, a forte-piano with the black and white keys reversed - books and abandoned plates of food. Mozart clasps his father's arms. Leopold is now seen as an aging, travel-stained man in clothes that need repair. His face is lined, and he is obviously not in perfect health. He carries the bag across the room. Constanze lies in bed. She sits up, startled. He opens the door of the bedroom. Constanze, who looks ill and tired, stares at Leopold. Leopold stares back from the doorway. He closes the door again. He picks up some pages of manuscript. Laughingly, the bystanders take it up, especially the children. As Leopold glares furiously about him, the actress succeeds in getting Constanze's wig firmly onto his head. Everybody bursts into applause. Applause. All the bystanders are watching. SMASH CUT: Salieri's masked face whips around and looks at her. A repetition of the shot of Mozart at the forte-piano, wearing Constanze's wig and emitting a shrill giggle.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He stands trembling, gazing frantically. Constanze rises, bewildered. Ecstatic, she pauses and kisses his hand. He lifts her and then holds her to him awkwardly. They gaze at one another: Constanze in complete incredulity. He scowls at her. Salieri sits at his desk, gazing up at the crucifix. Salieri gazes at the crucifix. Salieri rouses himself. A servant arrives. She glances at him questioningly, and drops the portfolio on the ground; pages of music spill out of it. To its grand and ponderous sound, Constanze begins to undress, observed by the appalled Salieri. He opens his mouth in anguish. The candle wavers over her as she discards her garments and prepares for his embrace. CU, the hearth. In it lies the olivewood Christ on the crucifix, burning. Mozart chuckles gleefully. Salieri offers him a glass of white dessert and a spoon. Mozart accepts it distractedly and continues conversing. Maniacal barking and howling. The corridor is full of hounds, at least five, all jumping up and racing about and making a tremendous commotion. Mozart, foppish in a new coat and a plumed hat for the event, has arrived to instruct at the house of a wealthy trader, Michael Schlumberg. Bluff, affable and rough-looking, he stands in his corridor amid the leaping and barking creatures, greeting Mozart. Abruptly the girl rises. Mozart grins at the parents. They grin anxiously back. Mozart slides along the bench, lifts his hands, and preludes over the keys. Immediately, a hound howls loudly. Startled, Mozart pauses. Mozart pauses. Astounded, Mozart begins to perform the Rondo again. The hound howls more loudly. He bows to them and exits the chamber. Both men hug. A cramped, low-ceilinged little chamber which nobody has organized for ages. Also, there are many vacant wine bottles; musical devices - among them a mandolin, a viola, a forte-piano with the black and white keys inverted - books and abandoned plates of food. Mozart holds his father's arms. Leopold is now seen as an aging, travel-worn man in garments that need mending. His face is lined, and he is evidently not in perfect health. He carries the bag across the chamber. Constanze reclines in bed. She sits up, startled. He opens the door of the bedroom. Constanze, who looks unwell and fatigued, gazes at Leopold. Leopold gazes back from the doorway. He closes the door again. He picks up some pages of manuscript. Laughingly, the onlookers take it up, especially the youngsters. As Leopold glowers furiously about him, the actress succeeds in placing Constanze's wig securely onto his head. Everybody bursts into acclaim. Acclaim. All the onlookers are watching. SMASH CUT: Salieri's masked face whips around and gazes at her. A repetition of the shot of Mozart at the forte-piano, wearing Constanze's wig and emitting a piercing giggle.

Nervously, they smile back. Along the bench, he slides, raising his hands, and over the keys, he preludes. Instantly, a loud howl is produced by a dog. Startled, Mozart is stopped. He is stopped by himself. Amazed, the Rondo is started to be played by Mozart again. A louder howl is produced by the dog. To them, he bows and the room is exited by him. Both men are embraced by each other. A cramped, low-ceilinged little room is observed, which has not been tidied for ages. Also, many empty wine bottles, musical instruments - among them a mandolin, a viola, a forte-piano with the black and white keys reversed - books, and abandoned plates of food are seen. The arms of his father are clasped by Mozart. Leopold, now seen as an aging, travel-stained man in clothes needing repair, is visible. Lined is his face, and obviously, perfect health is not enjoyed by him. Across the room, the bag is carried by him. In bed lies Constanze. Startled, she sits up. The door of the bedroom is opened by him. Ill and tired-looking, Leopold is stared at by Constanze. From the doorway, back is stared by Leopold. The door is closed again by him. Some pages of manuscript are picked up by him. Laughing, it is picked up by the bystanders, especially the children. As furious glares are directed by Leopold around him, Constanze's wig is succeeded in being gotten firmly onto his head by the actress. Into applause bursts everybody. Applause occurs. The bystanders are all watching. SMASH CUT: Around, Salieri's masked face whips and her is looked at. A repetition of the shot of Mozart at the forte-piano, wearing Constanze's wig, happens, and he emits a shrill giggle.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He stands shaking and staring wildly. Constanze, perplexed, gets up, kisses his hand joyfully. He clumsily pulls her close; they gaze at each other: Constanze in disbelief. He scowls. Salieri sits at his desk, staring at the cross. Salieri stirs as a servant appears, drops a portfolio, scattering music pages. To its grand sound, Constanze undresses while Salieri watches in horror, opening his mouth in distress. The candle flickers as she prepares for his embrace. The fireplace holds a burning olivewood Christ. Mozart chuckles, accepting a glass and spoon from Salieri absently. Dogs bark and howl loudly in the hall; at least five leap around, causing a ruckus. Mozart, in a new coat and plumed hat, arrives to teach at merchant Michael Schlumberg's home. Schlumberg, bluff and friendly, greets him amid the chaos. Mozart smiles at the parents, who nervously reciprocate. He slides to the bench, preludes over the keys, but a dog howls, startling him. Amazed, Mozart starts the Rondo again; the dog howls louder. He bows and exits the room. Both men embrace. In a cramped, untidy room with empty wine bottles and instruments like a mandolin, viola, and reversed-key forte-piano, Mozart clasps his father Leopold's arms. Leopold appears aged, travel-worn, and unwell. Constanze, in bed looking ill and tired, stares at Leopold as he returns her gaze from the doorway, then closes the door. He picks up manuscript pages. Laughingly, children take them. As Leopold glares, an actress secures Constanze's wig on his head. Applause erupts as bystanders watch. SMASH CUT: Salieri's masked face turns toward her; Mozart at the forte-piano, wearing Constanze's wig, emits a shrill giggle.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Shaking, he stares wildly; Constanze, confused, kisses his hand joyfully. He clumsily embraces her as they exchange disbelief. Salieri sits at his desk, staring at the cross until a servant drops a portfolio, spilling music pages. As Constanze undresses, Salieri watches in horror. A candle flickers, revealing a burning Christ on the cross. Mozart, chuckling, takes a dessert from Salieri. Dogs bark loudly as Mozart, in a new coat and hat, visits merchant Michael Schlumberg’s house. Amidst the chaos, Mozart plays the piano, but a dog's howl stops him. He resumes, but the howls persist, so he leaves. In a cluttered room full of wine bottles and instruments, Mozart embraces his father, Leopold, who appears ill. Constanze, looking tired, lies in bed as Leopold stares at her from the doorway. He then picks up manuscript pages, and children laugh at the actress fitting a wig on his head. Applause erupts. Salieri, masked, turns to see a shrieking Mozart at the piano, wearing Constanze's wig.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He stands there, visibly shaking and staring with wild, intense eyes. Constanze gets up from where she was sitting, her expression one of perplexity and confusion. Overjoyed, she suddenly stops in her tracks and tenderly kisses his hand. He gently raises her from her position and then awkwardly clasps her to him in an embrace. They gaze deeply into one another's eyes: Constanze is in complete disbelief, trying to comprehend the situation. Meanwhile, he glares at her with intensity. Salieri is seated at his desk, looking up intently at the cross. Salieri continues to fix his gaze on the cross. Eventually, Salieri stirs himself from his thoughts. A servant makes an appearance. She looks at him with an inquisitive expression and then lets the portfolio drop to the floor; pages of music spill out and scatter across the floor. To the grand and weighty sound of the music, Constanze begins to undress, her movements being observed with horror by the startled Salieri. He opens his mouth, visibly distressed. The candle flickers over her as she slowly removes her clothing, preparing herself for his anticipated embrace. Close-up of the fireplace: in it lies the olivewood Christ on the cross, consumed by fire. Mozart chuckles with a delighted expression. Salieri offers him a glass of sweet white dessert wine and a spoon. Mozart takes it absentmindedly and continues his ongoing conversation. There is hysterical barking and howling filling the room. The hall is teeming with dogs, at least five in number, all jumping up and dashing around, creating a terrific and noisy scene. Mozart, dressed with flair in a new coat and a plumed hat specially for the occasion, has arrived to provide a music lesson at the residence of a wealthy merchant named Michael Schlumberg. With a bluff, friendly, and somewhat coarse appearance, he stands in his hall surrounded by the leaping and barking animals, warmly greeting Mozart. Suddenly, the girl rises from her seat. Mozart beams a smile at the parents. They, in turn, smile nervously back at him. Mozart slides smoothly along the bench, raises his hands, and begins preluding over the keys. Instantly, a loud howl erupts from one of the dogs. Startled, Mozart halts his playing. Mozart halts his playing. Amazed and a bit taken aback, Mozart begins to play the Rondo once more. The dog's howling grows even louder. He bows courteously to them and then leaves the room. Both men engage in a warm embrace. The room is small, cramped, with a low ceiling and appears as though nobody has tidied it for a long time. It is littered with many empty wine bottles; various musical instruments, including a mandolin, a viola, and a forte-piano with its black and white keys reversed; books; and several abandoned plates of food. Mozart clasps his father's arms. Leopold now appears as an aging, travel-worn man, dressed in clothes that are in need of repair. His face is lined with age, and he is clearly not in perfect health. He carries the bag across the room. Constanze lies in bed. She sits up abruptly, startled. He opens the bedroom door. Constanze, looking ill and fatigued, stares at Leopold. Leopold stares back from his position at the doorway. He closes the door again quietly. He picks up some pages of manuscript. Laughingly, the bystanders take up the pages, particularly the children. As Leopold glares furiously around him, the actress successfully manages to get Constanze's wig firmly onto his head. Everyone bursts into spontaneous applause. The sound of applause fills the space. All the bystanders are keenly watching. SMASH CUT: Salieri's masked face swiftly turns around and looks at her. There is a repetition of the shot showing Mozart at the forte-piano, now wearing Constanze's wig and emitting a high-pitched, shrill giggle.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: He stands there, visibly trembling with noticeable intensity, his wild, fervent eyes fixed in a stare. Constanze rises from her seated position, her face a canvas of bewilderment and utter confusion. Overwhelmed with joy, she comes to an abrupt halt in her steps and gently kisses his hand with affection. He delicately lifts her from where she was positioned and then awkwardly draws her into an embrace, holding her close. They gaze intently into one another's eyes: Constanze is in complete disbelief, grappling to comprehend the unfolding situation. Meanwhile, he continues to stare at her with intense focus. Salieri remains seated at his desk, his eyes riveted on the cross. His attention does not waver as he continues to fixate on the cross. Eventually, Salieri stirs himself out of his deep thoughts. A servant appears. With an inquisitive expression, she looks at him and then lets the portfolio slip from her hands to the floor; pages of music pour out and scatter haphazardly across the ground. To the grandiose and weighty sound of the music, Constanze begins to undress, a sight that horrifies the already startled Salieri. He opens his mouth, visibly distressed and troubled. The candle flickers over her as she slowly removes each piece of her clothing, preparing herself for his anticipated embrace. In a close-up of the fireplace: the olivewood Christ on the cross lies consumed by fire. Mozart chuckles with a delighted expression. Salieri presents him with a glass of sweet white dessert wine and a spoon. Mozart absentmindedly accepts it and continues his ongoing conversation. The room is filled with hysterical barking and howling. The hall teems with dogs, at least five in number, all jumping up and dashing around, creating a fantastic and noisy scene. Mozart, dressed with flair in a new coat and wearing a plumed hat made especially for the occasion, has arrived to provide a music lesson at the home of a wealthy merchant named Michael Schlumberg. With a bluff, friendly, and somewhat coarse appearance, Schlumberg stands in his hall, surrounded by the leaping and barking animals, offering a warm greeting to Mozart. Suddenly, the girl rises from her seat. Mozart beams a radiant smile at the parents, who in turn, smile back at him somewhat nervously. Mozart smoothly slides along the bench, lifts his hands, and begins playing an impressive prelude over the keys. Instantly, a loud howl erupts from one of the dogs. Startled, Mozart halts his playing. Amazed and a bit taken aback, he begins once more to play the Rondo. The dog's howling intensifies, growing even louder. He bows courteously to them and then departs from the room. Both men engage in a warm and heartfelt embrace. The room is small and cramped, with a low ceiling, appearing as though it has not been tidied in a long time. It is littered with numerous empty wine bottles; a variety of musical instruments, including a mandolin, a viola, and a forte-piano with its black and white keys reversed; books; and several abandoned plates of food. Mozart clasps his father's arms, while Leopold now appears as an aging, travel-worn man, dressed in clothes that are in dire need of repair. His face is lined with age, and he is clearly not in perfect health. He carries the bag across the room. Constanze lies in bed and sits up abruptly, startled by the sound. He opens the bedroom door. Constanze, looking ill and fatigued, stares at Leopold. Leopold returns the stare from his position at the doorway. He quietly closes the door once again. He gathers some pages of manuscript. Laughingly, the bystanders pick up the scattered pages, with the children particularly eager to join in. As Leopold glares furiously around at the scene, the actress skillfully manages to get Constanze's wig firmly onto his head. Everyone bursts into spontaneous applause. The sound of applause fills the room, resonating in the space. All the bystanders watch keenly. SMASH CUT: Salieri's masked face swiftly turns, looking at her intently. The shot repeats, showing Mozart at the forte-piano, now wearing Constanze's wig and emitting a high-pitched, shrill giggle.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He stands, his body trembling with intensity as his eyes dart about wildly, conveying a deep sense of agitation. Constanze rises from her place, a look of perplexity etched across her features as she tries to make sense of the situation before her. Overcome with joy, she halts her motion and, almost as if driven by an impulse, bends down to plant a kiss upon his hand. In response to her gesture, he gently lifts her upright and, with a certain awkwardness, draws her tightly into his embrace. Their eyes lock, and they become lost in a moment of shared astonishment: Constanze's gaze is filled with disbelief at the turn of events, while his is intense and piercing. Meanwhile, Salieri, seated at his desk, finds himself engrossed in contemplation as he directs a long, unwavering stare towards the cross. After a moment, he seems to awaken from this reverie. A servant enters the scene, her eyes reflecting a silent inquiry as she approaches. Without a word, she lets the portfolio slip from her grasp, and it falls to the floor, causing pages of music to spill out in a disorganized, cascading flow. As these pages scatter, a grand and heavy sound fills the air, providing a backdrop as Constanze begins to undress, her actions under the watchful, horrified eyes of Salieri. A sense of distress ripples through him, and his mouth opens in a silent expression of inner turmoil. The candle's flame flickers over Constanze, casting a dance of shadows as she continues to disrobe, preparing herself for the anticipated embrace. A close-up captures the fireplace, wherein the olivewood figure of Christ, nailed to the cross, is engulfed in flames, burning away. In another space, Mozart chuckles with glee, while Salieri offers him a glass, filled with sweet white dessert wine, accompanied by a spoon. Mozart, absorbed in his own thoughts, accepts the offering absentmindedly and continues his conversation uninterrupted. A cacophony of hysterical barking and howling erupts, revealing a hall teeming with at least five dogs, each leaping and rushing about, creating a fantastic uproar. Mozart enters the scene, dressed with care in a new coat and a hat adorned with a plume, ready for his role as a teacher in the household of Michael Schlumberg, a prosperous merchant. With an air of friendly coarseness, Michael Schlumberg stands in the midst of the canine chaos, welcoming Mozart with a broad grin. Abruptly, a young girl rises from her seat, capturing Mozart's attention. He turns to the parents, offering them a warm smile, which they return, albeit with a touch of nervousness. Mozart moves gracefully along the bench, positioning himself before the keyboard, where he lifts his hands and begins to lightly play a prelude. The instant the music begins, a dog interrupts with a loud howl, causing Mozart to pause in surprise. He remains still for a moment, bewildered, before he attempts to restart the Rondo. This time, the dog responds with an even more emphatic howl, prompting Mozart to make the decision to bow graciously to those present and make his exit from the room. The two men meet again and share a heartfelt embrace. The scene shifts to a cramped, low-ceilinged room, neglected and untidy over time, scattered with the remnants of empty wine bottles, a variety of musical instruments—including a mandolin, a viola, and a forte-piano distinctive for its reversed black and white keys—as well as books and plates of food left untouched. In this cluttered space, Mozart stands with his father, clasping Leopold's arms in a gesture of affection. Leopold, appearing as an older man now, his face marked with lines of age and his attire worn and in need of repair, carries an air of weariness and declining health. He maneuvers a bag across the room with deliberate care. Meanwhile, Constanze lies in bed, and as the door creaks open, she sits up suddenly, her expression immediately shifting to one of surprise. Leopold stands framed in the doorway, locking eyes with Constanze, who looks back at him with a fatigued and unwell countenance. After a brief pause, he closes the door silently. Shifting his attention elsewhere, he picks up some pages of a manuscript, and those gathered around, especially the children, burst into laughter as they engage with the sheets, passing them from hand to hand with amusement. Amidst this jovial scene, an actress succeeds in firmly placing Constanze's wig onto Leopold's head, evoking a delighted applause from the onlookers. With the applause continuing, all eyes remain fixed on the unfolding scenario. In a sudden, jarring transition, Salieri’s masked face emerges, sharply turning to fix its gaze upon her. The scene quickly revisits the image of Mozart at the forte-piano, his head adorned with Constanze's wig, as he lets out a piercing, high-pitched giggle.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: He stands shaking, staring wildly, as Constanze, perplexed but overjoyed, gets up, kisses his hand, and is then clumsily embraced by him. They exchange a look: Constanze is in total disbelief while he glares at her. Salieri, at his desk and stirred out of his thoughts, looks up at the cross. A servant appears, looks at him inquiringly, and drops a portfolio, spilling pages of music onto the floor. As Constanze begins to undress to the sound of the pages falling, Salieri watches in horror, mouth open in distress. Meanwhile, a candle flickers over her as she prepares for an embrace, and the image shifts to a burning olivewood Christ on the cross in the fireplace. Mozart chuckles as he accepts a glass of white dessert wine from Salieri, continuing to talk. In a hall filled with at least five barking and leaping dogs, Mozart, dressed in a new coat and plumed hat, arrives to teach at Michael Schlumberg's home. Schlumberg, bluff and friendly, greets Mozart amidst the chaos. Mozart smiles at the nervous parents, then slides along a bench to play the piano. As he begins, a dog howls loudly, startling him. He stops, then resumes playing the Rondo, only for the dog to howl louder. After bowing to them, he leaves the room, and both men embrace. In a cramped, untidy room filled with empty wine bottles, musical instruments, books, and abandoned plates, Mozart clasps his father's arms. Leopold, now visibly aged and travel-worn with lined face and clothes in need of repair, carries a bag across the room as Constanze, tired and ill, sits up in bed, startled by his entrance. They stare at each other before he closes the door and picks up some manuscript pages. Bystanders, especially children, laugh and take up the pages, while an actress succeeds in fixing Constanze's wig onto Leopold's head, prompting applause from all. Suddenly, Salieri's masked face whips around to look at her, and the scene cuts to Mozart at the forte-piano, wearing Constanze's wig and giggling shrilly.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He stands shaking, staring wildly, as if confronted by a revelation. Constanze gets up, perplexed by the sudden change in his demeanor. Overjoyed, she stops and kisses his hand, a gesture of both relief and gratitude. He raises her, embracing her clumsily in the manner of someone who has not known joy for some time. They stare at one another: Constanze in total disbelief, her eyes questioning his newfound intensity. He glares at her, an emotion too complex to name flickering across his face. Salieri sits at his desk, staring up at the cross, a symbol of faith and burden. Salieri stares at the cross, contemplating his own conflicted belief. Salieri stirs himself, breaking free from his introspection. A servant appears, dressed in the livery of a wealthy household, looking at him inquiringly, and drops the portfolio on the floor; pages of music, the lifeblood of the household, pour out of it. To its grand and weighty sound, Constanze begins to undress, watched by the horrified Salieri who struggles between duty and desire. He opens his mouth in distress, caught in a moral quandary. The candle flickers over her, casting shadows that dance across the room, as she removes her clothes and prepares for his embrace. CU, the fireplace. In it lies the olivewood Christ on the cross, burning as if consumed by a sacrilegious fire. Mozart chuckles delightedly, his laughter punctuating the tension in the room. Salieri offers him a glass of white dessert wine, a sweet reprieve from the bitterness around them, and a spoon. Mozart takes it absently, lost in his own thoughts, and goes on talking. Hysterical barking and howling fill the air. The hall is full of dogs, at least five, all jumping up and dashing about, creating a cacophony synonymous with chaos. Mozart, dandified in a new coat and a plumed hat befitting his artistic flair, has arrived to teach at the house of a prosperous merchant, Michael Schlumberg, whose wealth affords him such extravagance. Bluff, friendly and coarse-looking, he stands in his hall amidst the leaping and barking animals, greeting Mozart with the enthusiasm of one whose status allows indulgence in extravagance. Suddenly the girl rises, interrupting the scene. Mozart smiles at the parents, who stand as patrons of the arts with nervous pride. They smile nervously back, aware of the genius before them. Mozart slides along the bench, raises his hands, and preludes over the keys of the forte-piano, a precursor to modern pianos with distinctively reversed keys. Instantly, a dog howls loudly, startling him and interrupting the melody. Startled, Mozart stops, his composure rattled. Mozart stops, assessing the discord in the air. Amazed, Mozart starts to play the Rondo again, a composition known for its lively character. The dog howls louder, adding unwelcome accompaniment. He bows to them, acknowledging the humor of the moment, and leaves the room. Both men embrace, a gesture of shared artistic respect and personal camaraderie. A cramped, low-ceilinged little room that has not been tidied for ages, speaks of creative chaos. Also, there are many empty wine bottles; musical instruments - among them a mandolin, a viola, a forte-piano with the black and white keys reversed - books and abandoned plates of food bear witness to the life of an artist. Mozart clasps his father's arms, a rare moment of familial affection. Leopold is now seen as an aging, travel-stained man, his clothes worn from years of journeying to support his family’s ambitions, in clothes that need repair. His face is lined, testifying to a life of struggle and dedication, and he is obviously not in perfect health. He carries the bag, heavy with the weight of responsibility, across the room. Constanze lies in bed, her frailty evident in her appearance. She sits up, startled, as if awakening from a dream. He opens the door of the bedroom. Constanze, who looks ill and tired, her face a mask of fatigue, stares at Leopold. Leopold stares back from the doorway, his expression a mixture of concern and regret. He closes the door again, shutting out the turbulence of the outside world. He picks up some pages of manuscript, the essence of musical genius. Laughingly, the bystanders take it up, especially the children, whose innocence contrasts with the gravity of the work. As Leopold glares furiously about him, the actress succeeds in getting Constanze's wig firmly onto his head, a farcical moment amidst the serious undertones. Everybody bursts into applause, a tribute to the shared joy of music. Applause. All the bystanders are watching, captivated by the spectacle. SMASH CUT: Salieri's masked face whips around and looks at her, a visage of secrecy and hidden motives. A repetition of the shot of Mozart at the forte-piano, wearing Constanze's wig and emitting a shrill giggle, the scene becomes a surreal blend of genius and madness.

He opens his mouth in distress. The candle flickers over her as she removes her clothes and prepares for his embrace. CU the fireplace. In it lies the olivewood. Christ on the cross burning. Mozart chuckles delightedly. Salieri offers him a glass of white dessert and a spoon. Mozart takes it absently and goes on talking. Hysterical barking and howling. The hall is full of dogs at least five all jumping up and dashing about and making a terrific racket. Mozart dandified in a new coat and a plumed hat for the occasion has arrived to teach at the house of a prosperous merchant. Michael Schlumberg. Bluff friendly and coarselooking he stands in his hall amidst the leaping and barking animals greeting Mozart. Suddenly the girl rises. Mozart smiles at the parents. They smile nervously back. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Mozart slides along the bench raises his hands and preludes over the keys. Instantly a dog howls loudly. Startled. Mozart stops. Mozart stops. Amazed. Mozart starts to play the Rondo again. The dog howls louder. He bows to them and leaves the room. Both men embrace. A cramped lowceilinged little room which nobody has tidied for ages. Also there are many empty wine bottles musical instruments  among them a mandolin a viola a fortepiano with the black and white keys reversed  books and abandoned plates of food. Mozart clasps his father's arms. Leopold is now seen as an aging travelstained man in clothes that need repair. His face is lined and he is obviously not in perfect health. He carries the bag across the room. Constanze lies in bed. She sits up startled. He opens the door of the bedroom. Constanze who looks ill and tired stares at Leopold. Leopold stares back from the doorway. He closes the door again. He picks up some pages of manuscript. Laughingly. the bystanders take it up especially the children. As Leopold glares furiously about him the actress succeeds in getting Constanze's wig firmly onto his head. Everybody bursts into applause. Applause. All the bystanders are watching. SMASH CUT. Salieri's masked face whips around and looks at her. A repetition of the shot of Mozart at the fortepiano wearing Constanze's wig and emitting a shrill giggle.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat wobbles trembling, peering frantically. Penelope springs down, baffled. Ecstatic, she pauses and licks the sheep's hoof. The cat elevates her and then hugs her awkwardly. They gawk at one another: Penelope in sheer amazement. The cat scowls at her. Fenton perches on his chair, gazing up at the shade. Fenton gapes at the shade. Fenton rouses himself. A baker materializes. He peers at him curiously and flings the sculpture on the carpet; sheets of poetry spill out of it. To its grand and hefty melody, Penelope begins to paint, observed by the terrified Fenton. The cat opens its eyes in anguish. The lantern wavers over her as she sheds her garments and readies for its cuddle. CU, the bookshelf. In it rests the mahogany angel on the gargoyle, sizzling. Beethoven giggles merrily. Fenton hands him a mug of red soup and a fork. Beethoven grasps it carelessly and continues chatting. Maniacal chirping and cawing. The garden is packed with birds, at least seven, all soaring up and flitting around and producing a tremendous commotion. Beethoven, adorned in a fresh cloak and a feathered cape for the event, has arrived to orchestrate at the residence of an affluent blacksmith, Gerald Landshire. Jolly, amicable, and rough-looking, he lingers in his garden amidst the soaring and chirping creatures, welcoming Beethoven. Suddenly the youth ascends. Beethoven beams at the companions. They grin uneasily back. Beethoven drifts across the mat, lifts his paws, and preludes over the strings. Instantly, a parrot squawks loudly. Shocked, Beethoven halts. Beethoven halts. Astonished, Beethoven recommences to strum the Sonata once more. The parrot squawks louder. He nods to them and exits the space. Both rabbits embrace. A narrow, high-floored cavern which everyone has ignored for centuries. Also, there are numerous empty cider jugs; artistic tools - among them a chisel, a palette, a grand-guitar with the red and yellow frets reversed - scrolls and forsaken cups of broth. Beethoven grips his mother's legs. Clara is now viewed as a seasoned, sun-kissed woman in attire that demands mending. Her visage is creased, and she is evidently not in robust condition. She hauls the trunk across the cavern. Penelope lounges on the couch. She leaps, amazed. She unlatches the window of the lounge. Penelope, who appears robust and worn, peers at Clara. Clara gazes back from the portal. She bolts the window shut. She seizes some leaves of novella. Giggling, the spectators lift it high, especially the youth. As Clara glares angrily around her, the performer triumphs in affixing Penelope's bonnet securely onto his feet. Everyone erupts into cheers. Cheers. All the spectators are observing. SMASH TRANSITION: Fenton's hooded visage swivels around and examines her. A duplication of the frame of Beethoven at the grand-guitar, sporting Penelope's bonnet and releasing a high-pitched chuckle.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A man named Salieri sits at his desk, staring at the cross, while Constanze, in disbelief, interacts warmly with him. As a servant drops a portfolio, music pages spill out. Horrified, Salieri watches Constanze undress, lit by flickering candlelight. Meanwhile, Mozart, amused, arrives at Michael Schlumberg's home to teach, welcomed amidst chaos and barking dogs. As he plays the piano, a dog howls, surprising him. Later, in a cluttered room filled with musical instruments and empty wine bottles, Mozart embraces his father Leopold, who appears aged and unwell. Constanze, looking ill, encounters Leopold, and they share a tense moment. Applause ensues as bystanders watch an actress place Constanze's wig onto Mozart, who emits a shrill giggle at the piano, observed by a masked Salieri.
